definitions.definition: at a short distance away from somebody/something

examples.text: Go and sit nearer (to) the fire.

definitions.definition: a short period of time from something

examples.text: My birthday is very near Christmas.
I’ll think about it **nearer (to) the time** *(= when it is just going to happen)*.

definitions.definition: used before a number to mean ‘approximately’, ‘just below or above’

examples.text: Share prices are near their record high of last year.
Profits fell from $11 million to nearer $8 million.

definitions.definition: similar to somebody/something in quality, size, etc.

examples.text: Nobody else comes near her in intellect.
This colour is nearest (to) the original.
She was **near to tears** *(= almost crying)*.

definitions.definition: close to you in time or distance

examples.text: The property is ideally located with all local amenities close at hand.

definitions.definition: to be fairly accurate in a guess, statement, etc.

examples.text: Such guesses are thought to be close to the mark.
‘The Times’ was nearer the mark when it said…

definitions.definition: having a lot of importance and interest for somebody
